iso_evolution.definition: Isomorphic patterns in evolution across scales capture structural equivalences in adaptive hierarchiesâ€”mappings where variations, selections, adaptations, and speciations preserve relations invariantly. These include hierarchical diversifications, environmental feedbacks, and self-organizing progressions, validated via systems theory (e.g., evo-devo reversals per web:4) and cross-scale analogies (e.g., quantum selections to cultural evolutions per web:3). Hard-to-vary invariants like adaptive persistence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm adaptation/deny stasis/both in drifts/neither in extinctions); scores >0.98 based on 2025 abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from systems theory/web and adaptive overlays (e.g., genetic drifts to algorithmic evos).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., cosmic evolution links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., co-evolution); integrate diachronic depth (primordial adaptations to 2025 AI evo algos).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.
